item.description:

item.title: Broken glass still there, 17th February
item.description:
I reported this 3 weeks ago, it was marked as resolved but the issue is still there. Broken glass still on the pavement at the beginning of Braemar Avenue. Hazard for dogs and children. Please take action on it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Martens Avenue, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tripping Hazard - Raised section of Pavement, 17th February
item.description:
There is a very nasty raised triangular section of pavement on Tooley st between the station and the Flat Iron restaurant. I tripped over it last night, nearly had a serious accident but someone managed to stop myself falling. Luckily I am fit and agile but a less able person would have been badly hurt. Please fix as soon as possible- thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 116-120, Tooley Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Pavement Defect (uneven surface / cracked paving slab)

item.title: Persistent dog fouler - Dulwich Park, 17th February
item.description:
There is a man, around late 50’s/early 60’s, that has 6 dogs (whippet, Dachshund, some perhaps cocker spaniels). He where’s a green wax (Barbour style) jacket, is medium/short build and greyish short hair. I have witnessed him on a number of occasions let the dogs off the lead and pretending not to see as they foul all over the park. I have confronted him once to explain that it’s an offence to allow this and he needs to be more responsible. However I have again witnessed this happening this morning. My son and his friends regularly have to contend with dog mess when playing sport in the park, with many of the parents (including myself) having to clean it up. Please can there be better monitoring and enforcement in the park as things have become generally much worse over the past few years. Specifically this man and his 6 dogs is clearly a large contributor.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carriage Drive, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ridiculous number of unsafe lime bikes - Newman street, 17th February
item.description:
